reviewText: Outstanding!!!! This is UB40 performing at their very best!!!! You get 21 great songs, that cover their entire career. Some of the favorites include:"The Way You Do the Things You Do""Here I am (Come and Take Me)""Kingston Town""Reggae Music""Red, Red Wine""(I Can't Help) Falling in Love with You""Cherry Oh Baby""Many Rivers to Cross"You get an approx. running time of 97 minutes.This is an outstanding reggae DVD, showcasing UB40 at their best. I highly recommend this one!!!! Thanks!!!!
summary: The Best UB40 DVD Ever!!!!! It is full of Great Reggae "Jam" Music from the beginning to the end!!!!!!!!

reviewText: This is an excellent showcase of what a great live band UB40 is! The "Don't Break My Heart" version is to die for!
summary: Greatest live reggae band in the world!

reviewText: Such a great band and great live performance.  I've been a fan of UB40 since their "Labour of Love" album.  They are a very tight and energetic reggae band.  Just bought this dvd and can't find enough words to describe how much I love it.  Has my husband and I dancing around our living room!  LOL  Try them and I know you'll like them!
summary: Please come tour the Dallas, TX area!
Title: N/A

reviewText: UB40 has always been an enigma to me.  I don't know anyone who hasn't heard "Red, Red Wine", and everyone loves the song.  So why aren't these guys more popular?  Theories:  1. For "real" reggae fans, these guys just aren't hard core enough.  2. They are difficult to categorize, leading to...  3. They struggle for radio airtime.  4. They're a mixed race reggae band from... England!Whatever, all they do is make great music, and it definitely is apparent on this concert DVD.  As others have pointed out, the A/V quality of this disc rivals Blu-Ray.  Similar to the Soundstage series of concerts, they recorded this show with high-def cameras - pretty expensive back in 2002!  So, even by today's standards, this show looks and sounds terrific.If I have one nit wth the show, it's that there is not all that much, visually.  The band is tight and look like they're into it, but there's not much going on up on stage.  There are a couple of theatrical tricks (one with fake fire), but other than that, don't expect any light shows or fog machines.  Of course, those things have nothing to do with UB40, or Montreux for that matter.  That's why it's a minor nit, and I'm still giving 5 stars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Highly recommend this dvd for any fan of UB40. These guys have been together since they were teenagers, and it really shows. Fantastic renditions of all my favorite UB40 songs, and I love it.
summary: Excellent UB40 presentation, brilliant quality and sound
